newsitem.title: USA: U.S. southern army HQ to move to Puerto Rico.
newsitem.headline: U.S. southern army HQ to move to Puerto Rico.

text.p: The U.S. army will shift its Panama-based southern headquarters to Fort Buchanan in Puerto Rico, beginning in October 1998, Army Secreary Togo West said on Thursday.
The move stems from the 1977 Panama Canal Treaty that mandates the departure of all U.S. military forces from Panama by December 31, 1999.
The U.S. Army South command now comprises nearly 3,000 active duty soldiers and 2,000 civilian employees. The move should be completed by September 1999, the army said.
The U.S. Army South is a component of the U.S. Southern Command, the unified armed forces regional command, which will be moving from Panama to Miami by September 29 this year.
Puerto Rico is a U.S. commonwealth.
